medical_text: Patient admitted with severe chest pain and shortness of breath. ECG showed ST-segment elevation. Diagnosed with acute myocardial infarction. Treated with thrombolysis and anticoagulation therapy. Patient responded well to treatment and was discharged with follow-up appointments.

Patient presented with fever, productive cough, and difficulty breathing. Chest X-ray revealed consolidation in the right lower lobe. Diagnosed with community-acquired pneumonia. Treated with antibiotics and supportive care. Patient's condition improved, and they were discharged with oral antibiotics.

Patient admitted with sudden onset of left-sided weakness and slurred speech. CT scan showed an ischemic stroke in the right middle cerebral artery territory. Treated with thrombolysis and started on aspirin. Patient's condition stabilized, and they were discharged to a rehabilitation facility.
